ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course allowed for a relaxed independent focus on your capstone project while also providing super interesting seminars with amazing guest speakers. Really expanded my knowledge on a variety of topics while also diving deep into the capstone project.
Learned about contemporary topics in energy technology and policy, as well as other climate change-related issues (like carbon capture and geo-engineering).
I enjoyed exploring a topic I was interested in more deeply and developing the presentation with Professor Oristaglio.
Worked on my capstone
I was able to explore a serious issue of my choosing in great depth throughout the course of the semester, which is a unique opportunity at Yale.

Completed the final credit for energy certificate. Gained a more thorough understanding of the energy industry and real world applications of the technical aspects learned in earlier parts of the certificate

I was Option 2, so I mainly worked on my capstone, but I also attended some seminars where we analyzed energy-related arguments and heard from guest speakers. I learned more about the energy transition, although the focus of the class seemed more about developing presentation skills and learning how to communicate science.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: lots of guest speakers, relaxed atmosphere, great professor.

Strengths: really engaging class speakers on a variety of topics
Weaknesses: limited class participation and discussion during the lectures
Think the course is perfect for students pursuing their energy studies capstone project, and also provides them with an array of interesting guest lectures to learn from.
The course is amazing in that it allows you to forge your own path and study a topic that is meaningful to you. The only way it could be improved is through clearer communication of logistics.
I dont think this course needs any revision
I liked the flexibility, especially as a second-semester senior finishing my thesis. The guest lectures I attended were all very interesting.
I love how flexible Professor Oristaglio allows the course to be, and how wide the variety of topics covered is.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 100% if you are in Energy studies this is a must
Yes, the course exposed me to many interesting topics and expanded my network of individuals passionate about the energy sector.
Yes, I think and believe that every Energy Studies student should take the course.
Yes, if you are in energy studies!
Yes, everyone in the Energy Studies program should do a capstone project if given the opportunity.
Would absolutely recommend this course to other students. The seminar style allows for deeper learning with professors and the material of the course is fascy

Yes, it was a great way to round out energy studies and, in addition to the personal benefits from working on my own capstone, it was nice to keep in touch with Energy Studies friends and learn about different projects.
